paper_abstract: We present a method for automatically selecting optimal implementations of sparse matrix-vector operations. Our software "AcCELS" (Accelerated Compress-storage Elements for Linear Solvers) involves a setup phase that probes machine characteristics, and a run-time phase where stored characteristics are combined with a measure of the actual sparse matrix to find the optimal kernel implementation. We present a performance model that is shown to be accurate over a large range of matrices.
paper_title: Performance optimization and modeling of blocked sparse kernels
